questions.question: Solve for $x$: $2(x + 7) - 3(2x - 4) = -18$.
questions.explanation: Distribute: $2x + 14 - 6x + 12 = -18$. Combine like terms: $-4x + 26 = -18$. Subtract $26$: $-4x = -44$. Divide by $-4$: $x = 11$.

questions.question: Which of these represents the Distributive Property used to solve $7 \times 102$ in your head?
questions.explanation: The Distributive Property allows us to break apart multiplication: $7(100+2) = 7\times100 + 7\times2 = 700 + 14 = 714$. Option A forgets to multiply 7 by 2. Option C shows the Commutative Property. Option D incorrectly multiplies the addends instead of adding them.
